title: 114_s1797
content: The Act titled "Connect with Veterans Act of 2015" establishes a Voluntary National Directory of Veterans. The "Connect with Veterans Act of 2015" establishes a program for outreach to veterans by covered entities, including the Department of Veterans Affairs, state agencies, political subdivisions, and Indian tribes. A national directory will be created to support this program. The "Connect with Veterans Act of 2015" establishes a national directory of veterans to support outreach programs by covered entities, including the Department of Veterans Affairs. The directory will be established using information from the Secretary of Defense and will allow participating individuals to update their information. The Secretary will establish mechanisms for disenrollment and reenrollment in the national directory of participating individuals. Privacy and security measures will be taken to protect the information of individuals in the program. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may use the eBenefits Internet website to operate the national directory, ensuring privacy and security. The program allows sharing of directory information to connect individuals with eligible programs and services. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs can share information in the national directory with entities relevant to participating individuals. Participating individuals can update their information, which will be transmitted to applicable entities. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs can share information with participating entities. If a participating individual wants to stop receiving information, the Secretary will notify the relevant entities. The Secretary is limited to sharing information from the national directory. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs can share information from the national directory, including the name, email address, postal address, and phone number of participating individuals, along with their preferences for benefits and services communication. The Secretary cannot sell information collected under the program and cannot share it with entities that are not participating. Participating entities cannot share the information with third-party or for-profit entities. Participating entities in the program cannot require individuals to purchase products or services or use the information for political communication. The Secretary will establish a process for participating entities to opt out of receiving information from the national directory. Congress encourages collaboration among entities in the same region to streamline information requests. Collaboration with third parties, like veterans, is also recommended. The Secretary will work with third parties to develop information for veterans. A plan will be developed to publicize the program and inform covered entities. The Secretary of Defense will provide a form for collecting contact information from separating Armed Forces members. The Secretary of Defense, in consultation with the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, will develop a form for separating Armed Forces members to indicate their intended residence, contact information, and desired benefits and services. The member can indicate the communication and outreach services they would like to receive, such as health care, education, employment, and housing, from the Department of Veterans Affairs or the primary agency of the State where they intend to reside after separation. The form developed for communication and outreach services for veterans shall include notice that information provided to agencies and departments will only be shared as authorized and upon request. Political subdivisions of States receiving information may share it with nonprofit organizations. The Secretary of Defense will ensure that the form for veterans' communication and outreach services will not be primarily electronic and that the information provided will not be sold, shared with for-profit entities, or used for political communication. Participation in completing the form will be voluntary. The Secretary of Defense will ensure that completion of the voluntary form for veterans' communication services indicates interest in receiving information from participating entities. Information submitted by a member of the Armed Forces will be transmitted to the Secretary of Veterans Affairs within 30 days of separation. The Secretary of Defense will protect the privacy of individuals who submit information. The Secretary of Defense will protect the privacy and security of information submitted under this subsection. The Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Labor will integrate the collection of information into the Transition Assistance Program. The Secretaries of Veterans Affairs and Defense will jointly submit a report within 180 days of the enactment of this Act. The Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs will submit a report to Congress on the program, including an assessment of the signup process, transfer of contact information, and participation of covered entities. The report to Congress will assess the effectiveness of efforts to protect personal information of participating individuals in the program, including challenges in receiving contact information, limitations on information use, and protection measures by covered entities. The report to Congress will evaluate the program's effectiveness, including benefits to participants, program participation, utilization, and potential improvements. The appropriate committees of Congress will review these findings. In this section, participating entity is defined as a covered entity that wants to receive information about participating individuals from the national directory and has not indicated otherwise. The term "participating individual" refers to an individual in the national directory who has expressed interest in receiving information from participating entities and has not indicated a desire to stop receiving such information.
